trans-unit.source: Tracking Messages in BizTalk Services portal
trans-unit.target: Tracking Messages in BizTalk Services portal

trans-unit.source: Monitor EDI and AS2 messages, batches, and bridges deployed in a <token>af_integration</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: Monitor EDI and AS2 messages, batches, and bridges deployed in a <token>af_integration</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: The tracking information helps you in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: The tracking information helps you in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Determines if a processing delay occurs.
trans-unit.target: Determines if a processing delay occurs.

trans-unit.source: Provides specific details of a message’s properties.
trans-unit.target: Provides specific details of a message’s properties.

trans-unit.source: Helps determine the flow of events when a message is being processing.
trans-unit.target: Helps determine the flow of events when a message is being processing.

trans-unit.source: To track messages processed by the X12 and AS2 pipelines, you must enable tracking as part of an agreement before you can view tracking data.
trans-unit.target: To track messages processed by the X12 and AS2 pipelines, you must enable tracking as part of an agreement before you can view tracking data.

trans-unit.source: To enable tracking, see <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New X12 Agreements</link> and <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link>.
trans-unit.target: To enable tracking, see <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New X12 Agreements</link> and <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link>.

trans-unit.source: To track messages processed by the EAI bridges, you must enable tracking as part of the Visual Studio application.
trans-unit.target: To track messages processed by the EAI bridges, you must enable tracking as part of the Visual Studio application.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.

trans-unit.source: Tracking of messages that failed in processing, is enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Tracking of messages that failed in processing, is enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: However, to track promoted properties and successfully processed messages, you must explicitly enable tracking while configuring the bridges.
trans-unit.target: However, to track promoted properties and successfully processed messages, you must explicitly enable tracking while configuring the bridges.

trans-unit.source: View and Query Tracked Data
trans-unit.target: View and Query Tracked Data

trans-unit.source: You can view and query tacked data using the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can view and query tacked data using the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>tpm_portal</token> to track messages based on three different criterion – messages, protocol (X12 or AS2), and batching.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>tpm_portal</token> to track messages based on three different criterion – messages, protocol (X12 or AS2), and batching.

trans-unit.source: To view and query tracked data based on messages
trans-unit.target: To view and query tracked data based on messages

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select the drop-down arrow against the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can filter the tracking data to be viewed.
trans-unit.target: Select the drop-down arrow against the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can filter the tracking data to be viewed.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Request ID
trans-unit.target: Request ID

trans-unit.source: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Track ID
trans-unit.target: Track ID

trans-unit.source: The ID received in response to sending a message to an endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The ID received in response to sending a message to an endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The tracking ID is same as the request ID that is sent back to the client.
trans-unit.target: The tracking ID is same as the request ID that is sent back to the client.

trans-unit.source: By default, the tracking ID you must have received includes a <embeddedLabel>_Gx</embeddedLabel> as a suffix, where <embeddedLabel><legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic></embeddedLabel> is a numeric number.
trans-unit.target: By default, the tracking ID you must have received includes a <embeddedLabel>_Gx</embeddedLabel> as a suffix, where <embeddedLabel><legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic></embeddedLabel> is a numeric number.

trans-unit.source: While looking at tracking information using the tracking ID, you must remove the <embeddedLabel>_Gx</embeddedLabel> suffix.
trans-unit.target: While looking at tracking information using the tracking ID, you must remove the <embeddedLabel>_Gx</embeddedLabel> suffix.

trans-unit.source: Event Level
trans-unit.target: Event Level

trans-unit.source: The event category (Error or All) that you want to filter in the tracking data.
trans-unit.target: The event category (Error or All) that you want to filter in the tracking data.

trans-unit.source: Endpoint URL
trans-unit.target: Endpoint URL

trans-unit.source: The relative endpoint URL where the endpoint is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The relative endpoint URL where the endpoint is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Date From
trans-unit.target: Date From

trans-unit.source: The start date/time from which the tracking data must be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: The start date/time from which the tracking data must be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Date To
trans-unit.target: Date To

trans-unit.source: The end date/time up to which the tracking data must be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: The end date/time up to which the tracking data must be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Event Level</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Event Level</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.

trans-unit.source: However, <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> must be filled according to local time zone.
trans-unit.target: However, <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> must be filled according to local time zone.

trans-unit.source: The default <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and default <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).
trans-unit.target: The default <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and default <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Search</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Search</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To view and query tracked data based on protocol
trans-unit.target: To view and query tracked data based on protocol

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, and then select either <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, and then select either <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select the drop-down arrow next to the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can track the messages.
trans-unit.target: Select the drop-down arrow next to the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can track the messages.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Applicable to
trans-unit.target: Applicable to

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Sender
trans-unit.target: Sender

trans-unit.source: X12 and AS2
trans-unit.target: X12 and AS2

trans-unit.source: The Sender can be a specific partner or any partner.
trans-unit.target: The Sender can be a specific partner or any partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Receiver
trans-unit.target: Receiver

trans-unit.source: X12 and AS2
trans-unit.target: X12 and AS2

trans-unit.source: The Receiver can be a specific partner or any partner.
trans-unit.target: The Receiver can be a specific partner or any partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Message Type
trans-unit.target: Message Type

trans-unit.source: The Message Type can be a specific type, like 850–Purchase Order, or any type.
trans-unit.target: The Message Type can be a specific type, like 850–Purchase Order, or any type.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Interchange ID
trans-unit.target: Interchange ID

trans-unit.source: The interchange ID for the message to be tracked.
trans-unit.target: The interchange ID for the message to be tracked.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Message ID
trans-unit.target: AS2 Message ID

trans-unit.source: AS2
trans-unit.target: AS2

trans-unit.source: The AS2 message ID for the message to be tracked
trans-unit.target: The AS2 message ID for the message to be tracked

trans-unit.source: Request ID
trans-unit.target: Request ID

trans-unit.source: X12 and AS2
trans-unit.target: X12 and AS2

trans-unit.source: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Date From
trans-unit.target: Date From

trans-unit.source: X12 and AS2
trans-unit.target: X12 and AS2

trans-unit.source: The start date/time after which the tracking data must be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: The start date/time after which the tracking data must be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Date To
trans-unit.target: Date To

trans-unit.source: X12 and AS2
trans-unit.target: X12 and AS2

trans-unit.source: The end date up to which the tracking data must be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: The end date up to which the tracking data must be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.

trans-unit.source: However, values for these filters must be filled according to local time zone.
trans-unit.target: However, values for these filters must be filled according to local time zone.

trans-unit.source: The default value for <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and the default value for <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).
trans-unit.target: The default value for <embeddedLabel>Date To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and the default value for <embeddedLabel>Date From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Search</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Search</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Once you see the filter tracking data, you can also download the messages from the portal.
trans-unit.target: Once you see the filter tracking data, you can also download the messages from the portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the row in the list and then click <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel> from the command bar to get an option to download more data.
trans-unit.target: Click the row in the list and then click <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel> from the command bar to get an option to download more data.

trans-unit.source: For example, for an X12 tracking row, you can download the EDI message, suspended message, and the corresponding correlated functional acknowledgements.
trans-unit.target: For example, for an X12 tracking row, you can download the EDI message, suspended message, and the corresponding correlated functional acknowledgements.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, for AS2 tracking row, you can download the AS2 message before encoding/decoding and the corresponding correlated MDNs.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, for AS2 tracking row, you can download the AS2 message before encoding/decoding and the corresponding correlated MDNs.

trans-unit.source: This is available only with the <token>af_integration</token> Premium edition.
trans-unit.target: This is available only with the <token>af_integration</token> Premium edition.

trans-unit.source: To view and query tracked data based on batching
trans-unit.target: To view and query tracked data based on batching

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Batching</embeddedLabel>, and then select either <embeddedLabel>active batches</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>completed batches</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> page, select <embeddedLabel>Batching</embeddedLabel>, and then select either <embeddedLabel>active batches</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>completed batches</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select the drop-down arrow against the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can track the messages.
trans-unit.target: Select the drop-down arrow against the <embeddedLabel>Search</embeddedLabel> box to see different fields based on which you can track the messages.

trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Applicable to
trans-unit.target: Applicable to

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Sender
trans-unit.target: Sender

trans-unit.source: Active and completed
trans-unit.target: Active and completed

trans-unit.source: The Sender can be a specific partner or any partner.
trans-unit.target: The Sender can be a specific partner or any partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.target: Receiver

trans-unit.source: Active and completed
trans-unit.target: Active and completed

trans-unit.source: The Receiver can be a specific partner or any partner.
trans-unit.target: The Receiver can be a specific partner or any partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Agreement
trans-unit.target: Agreement

trans-unit.source: Active and completed
trans-unit.target: Active and completed

trans-unit.source: The name of the agreement containing the batch configuration.
trans-unit.target: The name of the agreement containing the batch configuration.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Batch
trans-unit.target: Batch

trans-unit.source: Active and completed
trans-unit.target: Active and completed

trans-unit.source: The name of the batch that processes the message.
trans-unit.target: The name of the batch that processes the message.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <userInput>< Any *></userInput> as a wild card.

trans-unit.source: Request ID
trans-unit.target: Request ID

trans-unit.source: Completed
trans-unit.target: Completed

trans-unit.source: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The request ID of the message sent to the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Completed Time From
trans-unit.target: Completed Time From

trans-unit.source: Completed
trans-unit.target: Completed

trans-unit.source: The start date after which the batch is released.
trans-unit.target: The start date after which the batch is released.

trans-unit.source: Completed Time To
trans-unit.target: Completed Time To

trans-unit.source: Completed
trans-unit.target: Completed

trans-unit.source: The end date before which the batch is released.
trans-unit.target: The end date before which the batch is released.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Completed Time From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Completed Time To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Completed Time From</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Completed Time To</embeddedLabel> are always enabled by default in the search filter.

trans-unit.source: However, you must enter the value for these filters according to local time zone.
trans-unit.target: However, you must enter the value for these filters according to local time zone.

trans-unit.source: The default value for <embeddedLabel>Completed Time To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and the default value for <embeddedLabel>Completed Time From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).
trans-unit.target: The default value for <embeddedLabel>Completed Time To</embeddedLabel> is the current local time and the default value for <embeddedLabel>Completed Time From</embeddedLabel> is the current local time minus 24 hours (1 Day).

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Search</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Search</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Known Issue
trans-unit.target: Known Issue

trans-unit.source: Tracking events are captured up to the X12/AS2 message processing and correlation of the acknowledgements only in the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> (<embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>) tracking tabs.
trans-unit.target: Tracking events are captured up to the X12/AS2 message processing and correlation of the acknowledgements only in the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> (<embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>) tracking tabs.

trans-unit.source: If a message fails outside of the Protocol stage, the tracking view still shows the message as successfully processed.
trans-unit.target: If a message fails outside of the Protocol stage, the tracking view still shows the message as successfully processed.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, refer to the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab in Tracking for error details.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, refer to the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab in Tracking for error details.

trans-unit.source: As a tip, you must copy the Request ID from <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel> tracking tab and use that ID as a search filter in the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: As a tip, you must copy the Request ID from <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel> tracking tab and use that ID as a search filter in the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: The X12 Receive and Send Settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) provides information on the Protocol stage.
trans-unit.target: The X12 Receive and Send Settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) provides information on the Protocol stage.
